pros: Always kept "in the loop" of changes to schedules and also procedures.
cons: At times, too many "hands in the pot"

review_title: Nice place, no diversity or innovation
pros: Nice community that is generally supportive, wonderful experience for students--especially (and mostly) for undergraduates. Nice facilities. Nice is the key word.
cons: No innovation, struggle to get folks to think outside of the box, many employees are relatives. The last five years have been a roller coaster, glad some leaders left, miss others. No focus on corporate partnerships anymore---Etown is not a dynamic place no engagement in Philly, Harrisburg, Lancaster. The place is very inward focused.

pros: If you enjoy teaching and can get an opportunity extended to you, then that is a positive.
cons: In general, the institution is elitist and exclusive. If you’re not a full-time tenured faculty member, you simply will not have any opportunities for advancement. Higher level jobs do exist, but only for the inner circle and upper echelons.

pros: Time off during the holidays, free lunch, ability to be creative, free tuition!
cons: Pay was insulting low and raises did not occur, even with great end of year reviews.

pros: We don’t have to work too hard
cons: We don’t make a lot of money

pros: the benefits from free tuition, to great healthcare coverage and most likely a  big plus for most.
cons: HR and Management are either clueless or don't want to address the work environment of the campus. there are some where there;'s just not enough time or support to do their jobs and others like Admins that actually have so little to do they run their respective outside businesses from the campus offices. its no secret , don't waste your whistle-blowing time  because if they're forced to see it they'll have to actually deal with it.    so much waste when they need to count every penny.

review_title: Passive-Aggressive Raised to an Art Form
pros: Faculty are, for the most part, great folks, and there's a lot of strong academic work going on. Many of the students are very diligent, and there are great opportunities to help them grow and expand over their four years at the College.
cons: Senior management rules by fear and intimidation. 'Academic freedom' is a joke--dissenting opinions are harshly punished. Several people have been pushed out because their views didn't fit the ego of the provost. People have been routinely yelled at even for things they did right. Results are not rewarded. The best days were the days I was simply ignored and left alone.

pros: Flexible work schedule and a great working environment. Elizabethtown College is my home away from home were I have been enabled to learn and grow to my full potential. I have received a lot of hands on experience here at the college and would apply to work here in a heart beat if a full time position opened.
cons: For some people the campus might seem small, but this environment fosters close relationships with faculty and staff as well as other students.

pros: Very flexible hours and an easy way to make money. It is easy to find students that could use my help
cons: You get a lot of emails asking for tutoring help and sometimes you have homework, but no other tutors can do it at that time

review_title: It's a job, do what you have to and collect the paycheck

pros: No one gets fired (student workers) and you get an extra dollar on Saturdays. You also meet really great people.
cons: In the words of all student works... It's ETOWN.

pros: It was easy because I was also attending school there at the same time.
cons: Not great hours or very involved tasks.  Mostly mindless work but I wasn't a higher up person.
